alert.note: Alert for Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 3:10PM MDT until April 22 at 7:12PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River near Redfield affecting Spink County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River At Ashton affecting Spink County. James River At Columbia affecting Brown County. .For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River near Redfield. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, The water reaches the bottom of the bridge at the gauging location At 23.0 feet, The water reaches the bottom of the bridge 2 miles east of the gauge * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 22.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:45 PM CDT Thursday was 22.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.6 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued late Friday night by 1215 AM CDT.
